intro: Pilosella legiogudarica, commonly known as the Armenian hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It is known for its ability to withstand harsh climatic conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat. Pilosella legiogudarica is often found in meadows and open slopes at higher elevations.
